arm_group.description: Sperm donors and husbands of women with fertility disorders All controls must have a normal spermogram
Husbands of women with a pathological pregnancy

brief_summary.textblock:
The incidence of testicular germ cell tumors, the most common cancer in men aged 15 to 45
      years, has doubled in France in 30 years. Reasons remain unclear but a role of environmental
      factors, especially during critical periods of development, is strongly suspected. Reliable
      data on environmental exposure during this critical period are sparse.The discordant
      findings and the limitations of available studies underline the importance to conduct
      studies with sufficient statistical power to detect risk due to exposures during critical
      windows of vulnerability.

      We conduct a multicentric case-control study to assess this association. Cases and controls
      will be enrolled during a 18-month period. They will be interviewed by professional
      telephone interviewers about their occupational and residential history and about their
      domestic exposure to pesticides and other nuisances.

      An optional biological study to assess genetic polymorphisms known to be associated with
      testicular cancer will be proposed to every cases and controls.

      Mothers (or close relative) of cases and controls will also be contacted (with son's
      agreement). If they agree to participate, they will also be interviewed about antenatal and
      early life exposure of their sons to pesticides and other nuisances.

      Cases will be matched up with 2 controls (one of each group) both on age (+/- 2 years) and
      on recruiting center.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Case-control Study to Assess the Association Between Environmental, Domestic and Occupational Exposures to Pesticides and the Risk of Testicular Germ Cell Tumor

detailed_description.textblock:
Environmental exposure to pesticides will be assessed from subject's residential history,
      using a Geographic Information System.

      Occupational exposure to pesticides and other nuisances will be assessed by an industrial
      hygienist who will be in charge to encode all subjects and mothers' occupations.

      Domestic exposure to pesticides will be assessed from type, target and frequency of domestic
      pesticide use.

      Based on these 3 sources of exposure, a score of exposition will be calculated for each case
      and each control.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Men aged between 18 and 44 years old

          -  Born in metropolitan France

          -  Able to understand, read and write French

          -  Without any psychiatric and severe cognitive disorder

          -  Willingness to participate to the study

          -  Who has signed and dated an inform consent form

          -  Affiliated to a health care system

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Who has a legal guardian

          -  History of testicular germ cell tumor or cryptorchidism (only for controls)

study_pop.textblock:
Cases are patients with a testicular germ cell tumor. They will be recruited in the French
        infertility centers at the moment of sperm cryopreservation.

        Group A controls are sperm donors and husbands of women with fertility troubles. They will
        be recruited in the French infertility centers and in the medically assisted procreation
        centers.

        Group B controls are husbands of women followed for a pathological pregnancy. This group
        of controls will be recruited in the level III maternities.

intervention.description: Subjects will be interviewed about environmental, domestic and occupational exposures to pesticides during several periods of life Two blood samples will be collected at enrollment to study genetic polymorphisms

facility.name: CHU de Grenoble - Hôpital Couple Enfants

clinical_study.official_title: A Multicentric Case-control Study to Assess the Association Between Environmental, Domestic and Occupational Exposures to Pesticides During Antenatal and Early Postnatal Periods and the Risk to Develop a Testicular Germ Cell Tumor During Adulthood

overall_official.affiliation: International Agency for Research on Cancer

authority: France: Agence Nationale de Sécurité du Médicament et des produits de santé
France: The Commission nationale de l’informatique et des libertés

primary_outcome.description: Occupational, environmental and domestic exposures to pesticides and other nuisances will be assessed.
primary_outcome.measure: Assess the association between pesticide exposure during Antenatal and Early Postnatal Periods and the risk of testicular cancer during adulthood
primary_outcome.time_frame: at the end of enrollment (18 months)

required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description:
The association will be assessed during antenatal, postnatal early life and later life (adolescence and adulthood).
Occupational, environmental and domestic exposures to pesticides and other nuisances will be assessed.
secondary_outcome.measure: Assess the association between a combined exposure to pesticides and the risk of testicular cancer during adulthood
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at the end of enrollment (18 months)

secondary_outcome.description:
Polymorphisms involved in organochlorine metabolism pathways will also be assessed.
Biological study
secondary_outcome.measure: Analyse polymorphisms known to be associated with testicular cancer risk to explore gene-environment interactions
secondary_outcome.time_frame: one year after the end of enrollment

collaborator.agency: Institut National de la Santé Et de la Recherche Médicale, France

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case Control, Time Perspective: Retrospective
